p: Functional feeds containing essential oils, one of most commonly used group of phytogenics in aquafeeds, have received increased attention during these last years due to their antimicrobial, immunostimulant, antioxidant, anti-stress, and growth-promoting properties ( 3â€“ 5). Besides essential oils being repeatedly demonstrated to stimulate both humoral and cellular components of the fish innate immunity ( 6), numerous have been also shown to display a noteworthy antimicrobial activity against a wide range of fish pathogens ( 7, 8), putting them on the spotlight for the development of sustainable prophylactics. Particularly, phytogenics derived from garlic ( Allium sativum L., Alliaceae, Liliaceae), oregano ( Oreganum vulgare, Labiateae), and thyme ( Thymus vulgare, Labiateae) are among the most studied and administrated, due to their recognized health-promoting properties for aquatic species ( 6).
